properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Lilliput, Rutherglen.
  • There is a grassfire at Jacks Road that is not yet under control.
  • This grassfire is travelling in a easterly direction from East of Jacks towards Chandler road.
Staying close to a building where you can shelter is the safest option, as conditions can change suddenly.

Continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do:
  • Monitor changes, including increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility that indicates the situation is changing. 
  • If you are away from home, do not return.
If the situation changes you will need to leave quickly. Plan to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger.
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay.
Impacts in your area:
  • Avoid the area -keep the roads clear for emergency services to respond
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 09/12/2025 09:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
WATCH & ACT - GRASS FIRE - Stay Near Shelter
Incident Location: Lilliput-McPhersonsRd
Issue Date: Tuesday 09 December 2025, 03:03 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38654/moreinfo

This Watch and Act message is being issued for Lilliput, Rutherglen.
- There is a grassfire at Jacks Road that is not yet under control.
- This grassfire is travelling in a easterly direction from East of Jacks towards Chandler road.


Staying close to a building where you can shelter is the safest option, as conditions can change suddenly.

Continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Dandenong South.
  • There is a Factory fire in Kimberly Road, Dandenong South
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby roads and communities. 
  • This fire is currently not yet under control
There is currently no threat to the community, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do:
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
  • Emergency Services are responding 
Impacts in your area:
  • Traffic in the area will be affected.
  • Emergency services are on scene and will be for some time

This message was issued by Fire Rescue Victoria.

The next update is expected by 09/12/2025 03:50 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility:

The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.

  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Watchupga.
  • There is a grassfire at Sunraysia Hwy, Watchupga.
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads for quite some time. 
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following service can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Services on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire at Markwood. 
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued at 5.02PM, Sunday 7th December. 
  • There is a bushfire that started at Snow Road, Markwood that is now under control.
People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.
Impacts in your area:
  • All roads are now open.
  • Emergency services will continue to patrol and monitor the fire area over coming days.
  • Smoke or flames may still be visible, and the situation is being managed by crews.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous after a bushfire.
  • Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Report injured wildlife to Wildlife Victoria 03 8400 7300. For more information go to Wildlife Victoria Website. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Shelley. 
  • There is a bushfire at the pine plantation on Ridge Road near Shelley Road, Shelley that is contained.
  • Firefighters are working to fully extinguish this fire. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • This Community Information replaces the Community Information message issued at 2.29 pm, Sunday 7th December.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
